messages.title: A Record of Delivery. A Promise of More.
messages.content:
2010 - 2015 A RECORD OF DELIVERY
Cut the deficit by half, reducing borrowing by £3,000 for every household in Britain
Given an £800 tax cut to low and middle income workers
Increased the health budget each year to improve services and deliver 6,000 more doctors
Provided an extra £2.5bn a year for struggling school kids.

2015 - 2020 A PROMISE
Finish the job of balancing the books, on time and fairly
Cut Income Tax by a further £400 for ordinary workers
Guarantee mental health equality by increasing health spending by £8bn a year
Protect education spending from cradle to college

messages.title: Help Hazel Thorpe deliver even more
messages.content: Join Hazel Thorpe's Lib Dems, show support by displaying a window poster, help deliver leaflets, assist with clerical work, help on the core team.

messages.title: 3 great reasons to vote for Hazel Thorpe
messages.content:
£800 tax cut for 39,000 local workers.
£5,500 extra for Worthing West schools.
2690 more apprenticeships for Worthing West.

messages.title: Are Bailiffs being fair?
messages.content: The cost of having a bailiff collect money from arrears, how to stop bailiffs, why it's important.

messages.title: Keeping Up Appearances
messages.content: The entrance to St Andrews local Church, the high standards of repair expected in Tarring, the persistence of local Cllr Hazel Thorpe and others, dealing with impact of bad weather and keeping excess water at bay.

messages.title: Risking dumbing down education for all
messages.content: Concern about the financial strain on Colleges and Universities due to cuts, the impact on university funding, increased fees, questions about the value for money, the worry that the government is dumbed down version of education, which may affect the production of entrepreneurs and skilled negotiators.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The General Election here in Worthing West will be a close fight between her and a backing local Lib Dem campaigner.

issues.education: Risking dumbing down education for all - Concern about the financial strain on Colleges and Universities due to cuts, the impact on university funding, increased fees, questions about the value for money, the worry that the government is offering a dumbed down version of education.

images.caption: Hazel explains to a local resident how to switch to cheaper energy.
VOTE FOR Hazel Thorpe on Thursday 7th May to build a stronger economy and fairer society here in Worthing West & Tarring.
